plot: A lawyer learns that he may be a prophet.

Lawyer Eli Stone begins to see visions, including George Michael singing in his living room, and street cars in the lobby of his office building. Turns out he has a medical condition (aneurysm) that affects his brain and might be the cause of the visions (as well as those of his late father, whom he considered a deadbeat until finding out his dad may have been similarly afflicted). Eli takes on a case that pits him against his own firm, on the side of a mother and son fighting a drug company.—Ron Kerrigan <mvg@whidbey.com>
